statement.p: In 29.55 of the last 44 days it rained. How many days did it not rain? days

solution.p: We recall that a percent as a decimal is part/whole. Here that is \displaystyle\frac{{P}}{{44}}={0.2955}. We solve for P by multiplying by \displaystyle{44}. \displaystyle{P}={0.2955}\cdot{44}={13.002}. This is the number of days that it rained. We want the non-rainy days which is 44-13.002=30.998 We round that as requested to 31.
